which of the following logic operations would select a record when at least one condition is satisfied?
explanation: The NOR operation is a combination of OR and NOT operations. It only gives an output of true or 1 when none of the conditions are satisfied. Therefore, the OR operation would select a record when at least one condition is satisfied

The operation of a computer and peripherals attached to it is controlled by?
explanation: The system software controls the operation of a computer and its peripherals. System software, also known as the operating system, is the software that manages and controls the computer hardware and other software programs.

explanation: Devices like desktops and laptops, enterprise-class server computers, optical character recognition mobile phone requires system software to operate. Ananalogue camerais the only device from the options that will not require the use of system software to operate.

The following are types of errors in programming except?
The stages of software development do not include?
explanation: The software development process consists of several key stages: requirements gathering, analysis, design, coding, testing, and maintenance. It's important to note that conversion is not considered a stage in software development; instead, it refers to the process of transforming data from one format to another.

text: Express P(1 + \(\frac{R}{100}\))\(^N\) as a BASIC programming notation.
explanation: The BASIC programming notation for the expression \(P( 1 + R \div100)^N\) is P * (1 + R/100)^N. This is because in BASIC programming, the multiplication operator is represented by *, division by /, and exponentiation by ^.

text: An algorithm can be described as?

options.A: the output of the instruction to computer.
options.D: a sequence of instructions for solving a problem.

text: The major difference between low level programming language and high level programming language Is that?

options.A: low level languages need an interpreter while a high level languages need a compiler.
options.B: high level languages will not need a translator but low level languages do.
options.C: low level languages need a compiler while high level languages need an interpreter.
options.D: low level languages do not need translators while high level languages do.

explanation: The major difference between low-level programming language and high-level programming language is that High-level languages require the use of a compiler or an interpreter for their translation into the machine code. while Low-level language requires an assembler to directly translate the instructions of the machine language.

text: What will the following BASIC statement produce? PRINT "Afrikom Computer School" A .

options.B: An error indicating on the screen.
options.C: Afrikon Computer School displayed on the screen.
options.D: Afrikom Computer School printed on paper.

explanation: The BASIC statement 'PRINT "Afrikom Computer School"' will output the text 'Afrikom Computer School' to the screen. The PRINT command in BASIC is used to output or display text or variables on the screen.

text: The minimum number of computers that can constitute a network is?
explanation: A computer network is an interconnection amongtwo or more computers or computing devices. Therefore,The minimum number of computers that can constitute a network should be at least 2.

text: Which type of network topology is represented in Figure 2 above?
explanation: A hybrid topology is defined as a network topology that combines two or more different network topologies. A hybrid topology can be a combination of bus topology, ring topology, and mesh topology.

The following are functions of database management system except?
To make the entire slides in a presentation to have the same "look" in MS PowerPoint, a user  should?
explanation: Use a presentation design template: A presentation design template ensures that all slides have a consistent theme, including colors, fonts, and layouts, providing a uniform appearance throughout the presentation.

text: In MS Excel, the average of 10 numbers give B1, B2,...,B10 is?
To centre worksheet titles across a range of cells MS Excel, the user must?

options.A: widen the rows to centres the titles across the range of cells.
options.B: widen the columns to centre the titles across range of cell
options.C: select the cells containing the title text and use the fill handle to centre the text across the range of cells.
options.D: select any cell containing the title text and use the fill handle to centre the text across a range of cells.

explanation: To center worksheet titles across a range of cells in MS Excel, the user must select the cells containing the title text and use the fill handle to center the text across the range of cells. The fill handle is a small black square that appears in the bottom right corner of a selected cell or range of cells. To use the fill handle to center the text across a range of cells, simply select the cells containing the title text and then drag the fill handle down the range of cells. The text in the selected cells will be centered across the range of cells.

text: In graphics, a subscript text refers to a text that is positioned?

options.A: a little bit above a normal line of text
options.B: a little bit below a normal line of text.
options.C: at the end of a line of text.
options.D: at the front of a line of text

explanation: A subscript is a text that is positioned a little bit below a normal line of text.

Digital signals can be represented by:   
I. Binary Codes
Il.0 and 1
III. High and Low Which of the following options is correct?
explanation: Digital signals can be represented by binary codes (I), the digits 0 and 1 (II), and high and low states (III).

text: A single hexadecimal digit is represented by?
explanation: A single hexadecimal digit can be represented by 4 binary digits (also known as a nibble (or nybble).)

text: The decimal fraction 0.9375 converts to binary?
The EBCDIC coding system was developed on?
explanation: EBCDIC stands for Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code. It’s an encoding system that is used to encode 8 bits, because of 8 bit we can assign numeric values from 0 to 255 to different alphabetic, numeric, punctuation, control, and other special characters that are used in computing, communications, and text. EBCDIC was used in IBM mainframe systems in 1964. This allows machines to store and transmit textual information efficiently using the 8-bit format.
